title: Mo Zell named Dean of the University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa School of Architecture
author: Josh Niland
byline: By Josh Niland Mar 3, '25 6:21 PM EST
excerpt: Mo Zell has been announced as the next Dean of the University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa School of Architecture. She will take over from Interim Dean William Chapman beginning on April 16th, 2025. Zell said her aim will be to
text: Mo Zell has been announced as the next Dean of the University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa School of Architecture. She will take over from Interim Dean William Chapman beginning on April 16th, 2025. Zell said her aim will be to "magnify [the] ways design can address pressing challenges, from housing to climate resilience." During her 12-year tenure in multiple leadership roles at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee School of Architecture and Urban Planning, Zell has spearheaded many initiatives while overseeing its transition and restructuring as its Interim Dean after 2023.  This includes fostering several community partnerships geared toward the development of better housing in Milwaukee and driving innovative educational and research programs such as the Turnkey Housing initiative and Green Schoolyards project.  Related on Archinect: Mo Zell is named 2023-2024 ACSA presidentIn speaking to her understanding of design education as a preconditon of the health of the built environment, Provost Michael Bruno said: "Her expertise, vision and innovative approach will enhance the school’s impact on students, faculty and the broader community." Aside from her previous academic administrative experience, Zell has taught architecture at Clemson University, North Carolina State University, and Northeastern University. She holds degrees from the University of Virginia and Yale. Zell also served as President of the Association of Collegiate Schools of Architecture (ACSA) from 2023 to 2024.
html:
Mo Zell has been announced as the next Dean of the University of Hawai‘i at Mānoa School of Architecture. She will take over from Interim Dean William Chapman beginning on April 16th, 2025. Zell said her aim will be to "magnify [the] ways design can address pressing challenges, from housing to climate resilience."

During her 12-year tenure in multiple leadership roles at the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee School of Architecture and Urban Planning, Zell has spearheaded many initiatives while overseeing its transition and restructuring as its Interim Dean after 2023. 

This includes fostering several community partnerships geared toward the development of better housing in Milwaukee and driving innovative educational and research programs such as the Turnkey Housing initiative and Green Schoolyards project. 

In speaking to her understanding of design education as a preconditon of the health of the built environment, Provost Michael Bruno said: "Her expertise, vision and innovative approach will enhance the school’s impact on students, faculty and the broader community."

Aside from her previous academic administrative experience, Zell has taught architecture at Clemson University, North Carolina State University, and Northeastern University. She holds degrees from the University of Virginia and Yale. Zell also served as President of the Association of Collegiate Schools of Architecture (ACSA) from 2023 to 2024.
